snippet: Raised in a Swiss hamlet on a farm that is home to residents with mental disabilities, Wawrinka slowly made progress and finally broke through at age 28 by winning the 2014 Australian Open.
abstract: Swiss tennis player Stan Wawrinka credits his success to being raised in supportive, country environment of his family's farm, which doubles as home for 75 adults with special needs; defending French open champion's first coach was social worker at center.
lead_paragraph: Raised in a Swiss hamlet on a farm that is home to residents with mental disabilities, Wawrinka slowly made progress and finally broke through at age 28 by winning the 2014 Australian Open.

headline.main: Country Boy Stan Wawrinka Patiently Ascends Tennis’s Ladder
headline.print_headline: Wawrinka Climbs Rankings in a Laid-Back Country Way
